question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
The Ponde family's Powerjet pumps 420 gallons of water per hour. At this rate, how many gallons of water will it pump in 45 minutes?
inference:
1) Convert the time from minutes to hours:
$$ 45 \ \text{ minutes} \left( \frac{1 \ \text{ hour}}{60 \ \text{minutes}} \right) = 0.75 \ \text{hours} $$

2) Multiply the pumping rate by the time to get the total volume of water:
$$ 420 \ \text{gallons per hour} \times 0.75 \ \text{hours} = 315 \ \text{gallons} $$

Final Answer: $\boxed{315}.$ I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Since 45 minutes is $\frac{3}{4}$ of an hour, the Powerjet will pump $420\times\frac{3}{4}=\boxed{315}$ gallons of water in 45 minutes.
